text: <@U1JHMKC8H|huxd> has joined the channel
<@U1HDN2RFY|sean> has joined the channel
I create a network with three docker nodes, one member service and two validating peers. Then I create a chaincode and deploy it to network.
My question is that how to view log information in chaincode?
<@U11TAFPUP>: if the deploy was successful you should see the chaincodes running with “docker ps"
you can then view chaincode's log using “docker logs"
<@U10E1PFEH|mgk> has joined the channel
<@U0ULK2JPP>:
The result of deployment of the chaincode

Successfully deployed chaincode: request={"fcn":"init","args":["123"],"chaincodePath":"<http://github.com/chaincode-app-go|github.com/chaincode-app-go>"}, response={"uuid":"ad833b2f-bfaf-4db0-8072-52ab924b8f45","chaincodeID":"84b2e806c398e6ca8f2da9e2cf15333e823557efb90a5552fd02cdd11c500407","result":"TODO: get actual results; waited 20 seconds and assumed deploy was successful"}
I run with "docker ps"

CONTAINER ID        IMAGE                           COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS                                                          NAMES
1993cf579278        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   8 minutes ago       Up 8 minutes                                                                       prod_vp1_1
6d2f4aed1004        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   8 minutes ago       Up 8 minutes        0.0.0.0:5000->5000/tcp, 0.0.0.0:30303-30304->30303-30304/tcp   prod_vp0_1
6f6d7b2d24ce        hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc   "membersrvc"             8 minutes ago       Up 8 minutes        0.0.0.0:50051->50051/tcp                                       prod_membersrvc_1
0e1936b2fdd4        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   8 minutes ago       Up 8 minutes                                                                       prod_vp_1
I don't see any docker for chaincode here.
The deployment was not successful, was it?
<@U11TAFPUP>: I don’t think it was. We only see peers and the membership service
I expect your peer logs to show some deployment errors at the time of executing the (successfully) submitted deploy transaction
<@U11TAFPUP|joseph> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/joseph/F1UTN8ZHP/peers_start.txt|peers_start>

text: <@U0ULK2JPP>: When I deploy the chaincode, I don't see any error in the peer.
neither do I…. what does docker ps -a tell you ?

CONTAINER ID        IMAGE                           COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS                                                          NAMES
c46af7ecc256        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   11 minutes ago      Up 11 minutes                                                                      prod_vp1_1
06cc49f67db6        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   11 minutes ago      Up 11 minutes       0.0.0.0:5000->5000/tcp, 0.0.0.0:30303-30304->30303-30304/tcp   prod_vp0_1
ccd681def347        hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc   "membersrvc"             11 minutes ago      Up 11 minutes       0.0.0.0:50051->50051/tcp                                       prod_membersrvc_1
2fba9fb95fb6        hyperledger/fabric-peer         "sh -c 'sleep 5; peer"   11 minutes ago      Up 11 minutes                                                                      prod_vp_1
<@U11TAFPUP> : just double-checking, the above was with “-a” ?
surely
ok
I deploy the chaincode using sdk/node.
the messages are all about successful.
I don’t see any sign of deploy in the peer’s log
can you try the question on fabric-sdk too please ?
sure
for further information
my docker-compose file

membersrvc:
  image: hyperledger/fabric-membersrvc
  ports:
    - "50051:50051"
  command: membersrvc

vp:
  image: hyperledger/fabric-peer
  environment:
    - CORE_PEER_ADDRESSAUTODETECT=true
    - CORE_VM_ENDPOINT=<http://172.17.0.1:2375>
    - CORE_LOGGING_LEVEL=INFO
    - CORE_PEER_VALIDATOR_CONSENSUS_PLUGIN=pbft
  command: sh -c "sleep 5; peer node start"

vp0:
  extends:
    service: vp
  ports:
      - "5000:5000"
      - "30303:30303"
      - "30304:30304"
  environment:
    - CORE_PEER_ID=vp0
    - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLID=test_vp0
    - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLSECRET=MwYpmSRjupbT
  links:
    - membersrvc

vp1:
  extends:
    service: vp
  environment:
    - CORE_PEER_ID=vp1
    - CORE_PEER_DISCOVERY_ROOTNODE=vp0:30303
    - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLID=test_vp1
    - CORE_SECURITY_ENROLLSECRET=5wgHK9qqYaPy
  links:
    - membersrvc
    - vp0
